review: One of our favorites. Great kids menu. Gluten free buns for the burgers.  Each table comes with a slightly outdated iPad sort of device. For $2.00 the kids stay entertained and you don't have to look like those parents that always have an iPad babysitter.  You can order drinks from the iDrunk app. And when you are so drunk you fall out your chair from all the on demand drinks and iPad babysitter, they have art on the ceiling!  They thought of everything.  Love this place!  Good food also.

This was the restaurant we ate at for our anniversary. Visually it doesn't have anything that really differentiates it from other restaurants. Just an American casual dining restaurant with a bar and some televisions. The folks were friendly as well so let's get to the food.... Tower Of Onion Rings Turbo-Q Tavern Double Burger  What Is It: The tower of onion rings is 13 onion rings stacked up on a tower thingy and comes with campfire sauce and ranch. The burger comes with pepper jack cheese, caramelized onions, chipolte aioli, and triple s (bbq) sauce. Presentation: I love the look of the tower of onion rings as that's one of the more brilliant ways to present onion rings I've seen. The burger looks like a burger.  The onion rings get a perfect 10 for that presentation though. 6 for the burger.  Taste/ Final Analysis: The onion rings had a real nice coating on them both texture wise and taste. The campfire sauce was okayish but needed a little more kick and a little less sweet in my opinion. The ranch was like any other ranch and was fine. The burger was a very high quality burger. The meat itself was flavoured well as well as cooked properly. It really needed a lot more sauce on it to be a turbo anything. I think it was on the sweet bbq side but there wasn't enough in there to really even get an accurate reading. They did have a lot of pepper jack cheese on there to help with  the flavour but stop skimping on the sauces!!! Tower Of Onion Rings: So freaking cool and delicious out of 10 Turbo-Q Tavern Double Burger: 5.5 out of 10

It was National Cheeseburger Day and we decided to come here. Both of our cheeseburgers were well made and tasted great with just the right amount of char, yet still juicy. I loved the smoky flavor!  I had steamed broccoli instead of fries--I'd have preferred it with some butter and they would have brought it if I'd asked, but I opted to take the healthier route. Still was good. Bar service was a bit slow which was odd since it was a slow Monday. However, the drinks were fine. We'll come back.

Had not been to a Red Robin in a while and the wife and kid was all in for it so off we went .  The place was clean and looked fun and the servers were nice and good. How ever the food just did it seem to par.  My wife's burger was on the burnt side and I had to eat half my burger before I even tasted the guacamole that was on it.  The sweet potato fries and milkshakes were good. Just the burgers seemed to be lacking

I stopped in Red Robin to have a burger for my birthday. I think that it's great that I get a free one every year. We were greeted at the door right away and the host was very pleasant and friendly. He said that he was going to be our server but they switched in the middle of dinner but it was still no problem. When I got my burger it was cooked perfectly but my fries were cold. Well, somewhat warm I guess. I informed my server and she took care of it right away and brought out fresh ones in just a few minutes. I used to really enjoy Red Robin but the atmosphere seems to have changed along with the decor. I really liked the way that it used to be and I guess that's why I only go in two or three times a year now. I do think the prices could be a little lower, but I guess you pay for what they call atmosphere.

Overall , i liked this place, good food especially burgers, interesting atmosphere, varied menu, friendly wait-staff and a good location. i usually go here for something free thru their e-club but as gourmet burger places go, i also like their endless fries which comes with the burger and they offer a lot of options of toppings & such.

Ask for Adrienne!! She knows her stuff, is super friendly and kind! This place is great for gluten free options. Pretzel bites are to die for, and the turkey burger can't be beat. We will be coming back!! (Also the hostess was very very sweet and welcoming)
The food and service was great. I never knew they had a bar. The server was professional and courteous. The atmosphere was clean and fun.

So hubby and i went there for lunch. it wasn't crowded. The waitress was nice.  I had hoped for a restaurant with a bar, but the RR in Florence was more like a bar with some food.  I ordered the Guacamole bacon burger with fries and a drink. Hubby ordered just a soda as he wasn't hungry.  On our table was an mp computer trivia game that hubby found quite entertaining. He played games while I ate.  The burger and fries were okay - nothing to write home about or make me crave another trip to the restaurant. not 'gourmet' as advertised. I can make a better burger on my grill at home.   The floor was cement and not exactly clean. the table was wobbly. The kicker came with the bill - $23.99 for 1 burger & fries combo and 2 sodas.  OH and the trivia game had a $1.99 surcharge that the waitress *didn't* mention. bottom line?  WAY overpriced for what you get and not mentioning the trivia game surcharge was obnoxious.

First time every visiting a Red Robin and the food was just like what they advertise in the commercials....Red Robin, YUM!!!! I ordered the smoke and pepper burger which came with steak fries per the recommendation of our waitress.  Great choice.  The burger was flavorful and juicy.  My fiancé had the royal red robin (may sure you tell them to fry the egg hard unless of course you like your egg runny...eeew ).  Overall my experience was good and will definitely be returning to try other burger selections.   P.S. Sports lovers this is a good spot to grab a beer and burger and watch the Sunday, Monday, or Thursday night game.

Update: We did go back and I realized I have to substitute a sirloin burger for the regular burger that they use. There is an up charge but it really makes all the difference. The other burger just tastes low quality but the sirloin is awesome. And definitely try a milkshake to finish your meal! "I wasn't overly impressed with my burger (the guacamole bacon burger), but my fiancé absolutely devoured his (the smoke & pepper burger). Even the meat and bacon on mine seemed to be a lower quality than on his. I know his is considered a "specialty" burger but as I'm paying $12 for mine, I still expected it to be a damn good burger. Instead, it was just meh. My guacamole was brown. The bacon was thin and chewy. My mac & cheese was really good, if not a little too cheesy. The fiancé got the pumpkin spice milkshake which tasted exactly like pumpkin pie. It was delicious. We will probably be back and I'll have to try my luck with a different burger. The service was okay. Not overly good, but not bad either. I told her it was my first time and she didn't have any recommendations other than "everything is good, I know it's hard to decide.""

Went there last night for supper. When we got there, they really weren't busy but Trump was in town & interstates were closed. By the time we left, they were hopping. It was our first & probably our last time there.  We asked for a booth & was seated in the bar area in a half booth, half table, this was real nice, but it was near a door & I had to put my jacket on as I got cold. We also told our waitress this was our first time there. She suggested our appiterzer of onion rings. We got an appiterzer of a short stack onion rings. They were good & the dipping sauce was very good. My husband ordered a simple burger & was told lettuce, tomatoe, onion & pickle were on the side, along with steak fries. I got a bacon peperjack cheeses burger with steak fries & ranch dipping sauce. When we got our burgers, we were hungry & ate them. Our waitresses checked on us several times. But quite frankly, the gourmet burger it wasn't. We both had to look for our burger. For the burgers to be 1/3 if a pound, I expected a thick juicy burger. The lettuce, tomatoe & onion for my husband was next to nothing. When we went to pay, the waitress asked if we had loyalty card, we told her this was our first time here, she skipped the loyalty card & went right where we paid. $40 for two flat non tasting burgers, steak fries that were all right & pretty good onion rings. For this price, we could have gone to a steak house & had a better meal.

We decided to stop into this location on our way home from the Cincinnati Zoo a few days ago. Wanting to try something new we thought this would be a reasonably safe bet. The restaurant was clean with fun decor and unlike some other reviewers we had excellent service. The freckled lemonade was delightful and came with free refills. I ordered the whiskey river chicken while my partner for the tavern double. Both were very tasty and you can't beat bottomless fries! A good price for good food. Nothing that was super exceptional but definitely would stop again!

I have always loved Red Robin. However, today not liking it at all. Went to the one in Flornece Kentucky and multiple seats were empty and clean. I was told very rudely that the wait would be at least 25 minutes. Why???????????? And why the need for the hostess to be so rude????? Not planning on going there anytime soon! Unfortunately, I had to give them a 1 star rating to be able to post this but I really want to give them a big fat zero!!!

Been here several times and for the most part the experience is always good.  Here is the 411 and why they only get 2 stars.  -While my party of 4 is being seated, a waitress intercepts the hostess and says, "can't seat them on this side we are way understaffed"...so we go to the other side. -The table we are seated at is dirty, crumbs on the chairs, food on the floor, and greasy prints on the chair backs -Silverware was soap stained and dirty -Was there around 3pm and restrooms were DISTGUSTING and could not have been cleaned during the day However, the food was very good as usual and our waiter was solid.   Staff correctly and keep your restaurant from looking and feeling like a dump!

This is my first time at a Red Robins and it was pretty good. I got the royal red burger, garlic fries and some cheese curds to start off.  All of it was excellent and cooked right.  Everyone else at are table was satisfied with our meal.  To finish it off I tried the Blue Moon milk shake and it was excellent as well! Our waitress made a few mistakes but we were a table of 8 with three small kids and we kept her running the whole time.  All in all she did a good job considering the situation.

Food was amazing as always. However, also as usual, service was lacking.  I would start by saying they were all very friendly. Now the issues started when they lost my son's food, but it was comp'd and a replacement brought out fairly quick.  Later on, we waiting quite a while for the opportunity to get drink and fry refills, even after pressing the call server button.  Better service than other visits.

Had the blue ribbon burger and garlic herb fries. I had peach tea and mom had lemonade with the same meal.  All of it was delicious. Made perfectly, cooked to our requests. I would suggest requesting more blue cheese if you like it to be potent on the burger.  Very clean facility too!  Now here goes the service, the absolute best part.  Our waitress was Kelsey and she seriously did absolutely everything I want to be done by my waitress. She refilled my drink before I needed and got our check to go cups the whole nine yards so fast. She's amazing and deserves a raise. I swear i didn't know good service like this still existed!!!

I recently stopped in and bought a big sky burger and it's my favorite burger there now. Definitely try that one and don't worry the Sriracha isn't too strong. All of the burgers come with bottomless fries but I've never had room for additional fries. The salads are ridiculously large. Unless you need those extra fries it's a bit expensive just for a burger. The service is always pretty exceptional here and last night was no different. Our waitress had a table next to us that seemed like a handful and she handled it really well. The manager was handling everything well too.

I was passing through and had dinner here tonight and won't be back. The food was sub-par and bathrooms were dirty. Our server forgot to bring us silverware and offered no apologies when I got up to get some, and wasn't well kept, had too long of a shaggy beard with little things hanging from it (jokingly said one of them kept falling out...gross!). And he kept pushing drinks and shots on us! It was late afternoon and we already said we were in the road. Not ok! Guy at the front (host? server?) was very pleasant.

Over the last year, the place has become horribly managed.  I used to go all the time.  Now the floor is so dirty every time I go in, I can't even see it.  Booths are dirty.  New decor is horrid, and salads and other food has gotten much smaller and worse.  We won't go anymore.

I'm not going to be exhaustive in this review.  Red Robin is a national chain, it's got it's fans/crowd (from what I can tell) and has a mostly kid-friendly menu for family dining.  We had a gift card, so we tried this location once again.  A couple years ago we had a gift card and had a pretty bad service experience. We were seated with a very short wait at a table that matched our need for seating. The food was fine, cooked well and ready in a decent amount of time.   Our server, Samantha, was very attentive to our crowd of kids, refilled beverages and was personable.  I actually wrote the company to tell of her great service that evening. 3-stars: I'm not head-over-heels with Red Robin - but it was a fine experience.  Our server was the highlight...train all your staff like that, RR. //

3 stars for the food, 5 stars for the service! Bottomless steak fries?? Yes yes yes!!!  This was my very first time at Red Robin because I don't generally like to go to chain restaurants for burgers (one of my favorite foods!).  I came here with a group of 25 for a friend's birthday dinner.  I ordered the mushroom burger which I was disappointed with.  I ordered it to be cooked medium but it came out pretty much well done.  Also, it was underseasoned for my taste.  The steak fries were amazing though, but who can really mess up frying french fries?   The service, however, was top notch!  The waiters were very attentive and quick.  They noticed almost immediately when a drink was empty or when an order of fries needed to be refilled.  This was especially impressive with the large party I was with.  They were also very gracious in printing out separate checks for each of us.  Absolutely wonderful service!

Great place for burgers plus you get bottomless fries (if you can get through the huge burger).  There was a large party here and some orders must have gotten messed up because a manager came over and asked if we liked cheesesticks and then gave us a free order - amazing!  Food was good. Happy hour is 3-6 and 8-? Monday through Friday. Good drink specials and pretty good food specials.

Bottomless steak fries? Yes please! However, because the burgers are so big, I rarely have the space for more fries in my belly. Definitely a disappointment, but not a bad one.  Overall, I love Red Robin, and out of the numerous burgers I've had there, I've never been disappointed. Additionally, in terms of the service, they are always quick  and attentive about refilling your drink the moment it gets low. Pluls, they're always so friendly!  Only downside on my last trip there was that the food was a tad slow to come out, but no real complaints.  Go hungry! You'll be sure to leave with a fully belly.

Good quality cheese burger, with tasty fries...however the service was poor enough that I never did get a refill.   Prices, particularly the beer prices are too high for the level of service and surroundings.

Very disappointing.  Had the chili burger and chili fries.  The chili tasted old/stale and the burger had absolutely no flavor.  The rating would have been lower but the milkshake outstanding and the only thing I finished.  Won't go back to the chain.

It's the closest RR, but still quite a drive away. I come here every time I visit Kentucky and I'm talking 2-3 times during one visit. I can't shake their bottomless steak fries paired with their seasoning! The service is always great and they check up on you without overdoing it; they bring more fries when you're almost done and the same goes for their bottomless drinks. My most recent visit I had the RR cheeseburger, which was pretty good. I also got the Freckled Lemonade, yum!  I also really like their bruschetta chicken sandwich and love their mint brownie shake. The towering onion rings is heavy stuff, but good and worth a try, at least once. The spinach and artichoke dip is pretty good too. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on their menu, even the entrees. I would definitely come back to this Red Robin the next time I'm in KY!

My friend, Benita, brought me for my first ever visit to Red Robin and it will most certainly not be my last. My mushroom burger could have easily fed two and was very well made. The fries were excellent and the service was excellent. The manager, Ryan, even stopped by to see how our food was. (In my normal experience you don't see a manager unless there's a problem.) I may have found a new favorite burger joint.

Amazing food, great atmosphere and even better staff. Our waiter was just wonderful and always refilled out glasses when we weren't looking! They are so friendly here and have an ample amount of parking.

Called ahead to see if they would accept reservations for a large party - was told no but the wait could be no more than 15 minutes - RIGHT - it was a 40 minute wait for a party of 7- they then seated us in the bar - it was FREEZING - the waitress was friendly but not overly competent - hubby ordered soup - asked for crackers....NOPE - manager informed us that the kitchen staff advised that crackers were no longer an item at Red Robin - REALLY??  The rest of the food was borderline - I ordered the seafood platter ( shrimp was WAY overcooked) - The slaw for good - honestly  I think it's the bottomless drinks and fries that get people excited - I'm sure for teens and young people that's a draw- I'd rather get what I pay for!  The bill was $167.00 not including the tip -  Will not return to this establishment - very disappointed.

Great concept of having bottomless fries with your meal. I have been to RR a few times and it depends on who waits on you as far as your satisfaction. If you have to wait for the fries to be replenished at the end of the meal then it's useless to have bottomless fries. I had this experience once at RR. Another issue is the replenishment of drinks. If you get halfway through the meal and your drink is empty, you have to wait until your server notices that you need  a refill and your food may be cold by the time you get a refill to wash the food down. I like the food and the concept(s) of free refills however this has to be sync'd to work. RR is still one of the better places to eat a burger.

I had the Oktoberfest burger.  Even got $3 off for signing up for the Loyalty card.  I know, they just want to capture my info.  Well, they got it now.  Hopefully they won't send me emails several times a week, or I'm gone. I really wanted to taste the pretzel and the burger, so I removed the ham and onions.  A little mayo and it would have been perfect.  Next time I'll order it this way. The server did an excellent job.  The price was reasonable.

A vegan burger, ENDLESS fries, and fruity drinks- yep, I'm a fan. Seriously, a place that serves endless fries is going to be alright in my book no matter what else they're serving!  This location is nice, fairly new, and have always had great service.  They have happy hour specials on drinks- yay!  Great for families, big groups, dates, everything!  Would definitely recommend to anyone who likes a good vegan burger... or regular burger, if you're into that sort of thing. :

Nev er had a bad experience at Red Robin until tonight.  Food took an hour to reach the table after the server walked around the room with it.  The food was room temp, not even warm.  The girls pointed at our table three times, saying where's their food.  The waitress did not ask us about refills on drinks.  The floor was filthy, food just pushed out of the way, one of the waiters fell next to our table.  The two year old had to sit in a filthy dirty high chair, mashed banana and applesauce from another child.  The manager brought us three baskets of french fries after we were finished eating.  To their credit, the  manager did come and talk to me and did make it right.  Four years of eating at Red Robin's Medford, Oregon, Omaha, Nebraska and Cincinnati, Ohio and always had excellent service and excellent food.  I'll give them another visit.

Great food! Great decor! Outstanding service!  The food came out in maybe 5 minutes!  We weren't even finished with our appetizer. 5 stars for being a premier franchise!  Not a huge fan of franchise restaurants as there is always better food at local restaurants, but Red Robin always delivers!  One of my favorite franchise restaurants for dinner.  The steak fries are good too.   The Oktoberfest burger was delicious.  As are their chicken wraps (tried in San Antonio) and other burgers (Indiana and L.A.)  Never a bad meal!  Also, plenty of TVs at this location with football playing on Saturday night!

I've only eaten in once and the food was great but the service wasn't all that great. But I've gotten carry-out a bunch of times and they are always super fast and friendly and give me extra fries when I ask.

I meet a group of 5 or more ladies that I don't see but a few times a year. We're heavy conversationalists and maybe that's why we keep getting the servers who want to join in our conversation, but not really do their job?  We've never experienced the bottomless root beer or fries. I'm of the opinion if those items like soda are getting low and you want to talk to us, ask if we want more rather than jumping in our conversation.  The food and atmosphere is like any other Red Robin, plenty of options and lots of kids.

Nice and clean location. Ordered the Whiskey River BBQ wrap. It wasn't prepared exactly as I'm used to but the waitress, Laura, and the manager could tell that I wasn't completely happy without me having to speak up. Manager asked if he could have another prepared. The second one was perfect! Everything else was just what I've come to expect from Red Robin, attentive staff and pleasant afternoon meal. Thanks Red!

They have awesome sweet potato fries and the A-1 burger is yummy.  My hubby has their loyalty card, so every time his birthday rolls around, he gets a free hamburger from these guys.  The wait staff is very professional and gracious.  I wish that more restaurants had such great wait staff!!

I really like this place. So far I've been twice, and both times the food was great. The first time I had the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger which was a really good burger! My husband had the Bacon Cheeseburger and he really enjoyed that as well! For an appetizer we had the Game Day Nachos, which was also really good. The second time I went was during happy hour so the appetizers were cheap. Since it was so cheap, we decided to have 2 appetizers because it never hurts to have leftovers, and that way we could try more things. We had the Cheeseburger Con Queso & the Triple S. Riblets. I really enjoyed the Cheeseburger Con Queso, but the Riblets... not so much! They were too sweet and I just didn't care for the sauce at all. Plus the price was way too high for the amount they give you.  For my meal I had the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap with a cup of Potato Soup. Both were really good. My husband had the Whiskey River BBQ Burger which he also really liked. Over all the food is really good, but it is overpriced. The burgers are about $9.00-$10.00, and although they do come with unlimited refills on fries... the fries are just okay, and the burgers are so big that I would never get a refill anyways.  They do have a Red Royalty card though that's perks are pretty sweet so it kinda helps make up for the overpriced food. You get a free appetizer that has to be used within 14 days of registering the card. You will also get a free burger during your birthday month. There are also other deals like buy 9 burgers get the 10th free.  I also enjoyed the fact that when I bought a couple of gift cards from here for Christmas, I got 2 free 5.00 gift cards for myself. Overall I give this place a 4. I'll definitely go back. I would give it a 5 if either the price went down a bit, or the fries got better.

For the longest time could not figure out what was going into the corner of Hopeful/ Houston rd and 18 next to K-mart in Florence. I was thinking it was going to be a Ruby Tuesday for the longest time, then they finally put the sign up. Red Robin. I said"great can not wait to to there". first time I ate at a Red Robin was up north off of Union-Cincinnati Day rd in Ohio about 3 years ago. Was very impressed with the food.  So we go there a week later when it opened. It was packed. I ordered the egg on top of the burger, it was not bad. The endless fries were ok. The service was great. Really like the ambiance. Busy busy busy. Would probably go back again.

YUMMMMM! I've been here many times before, so I knew exactly what I wanted when I got here!  A BOTTOMLESS ROOT BEER FLOAT!  Only $2.99!  How can you go wrong?  I've never had anything here that was bad.  They meet all your expectations and have your traditional American food...burgers, chicken...bottomless steak fries...onion rings.  All the delicious stuff that is soooooo bad for you. Great place for the family or with a group of friends!

I had been playing Angry Birds on my Droid on our way to Red Robin, and it really got me thinking - there should be some tie-in between the two. I hadn't been at a Red Robin in nearly a decade, and have yet to get a chance to eat at the one that just opened in the area. So, there was certainly no objection on my end when we all decided to stop in. Teenage Weg has fond memories of chomping down on a burger with mozerella sticks on top. 'Cause that's how I roll. Sadly that burger no longer was on the menu, so I went with their Mushroom 'n' Swiss offering. I really like Mushroom 'n' Swiss burgers. For me their scale does not go from Bad to Great, it goes from Awesome to Phenomenal. This burger was in the phenomenal camp, if only because they had about a pound of shroomy goodness on it. (Which actually was the name of my hippie cover band during my "wild days"). If you like mushrooms, you'll have a good time. They're kind of love it or hate it food, so I'd imagine you'd dislike it if you're in the latter. My only minor gripe with the whole experience is that our server was super, super helpful. Way too helpful. "Are you sure there are other customers in the restaurant?" helpful. No exaggerating, she probably visited our table six times after receiving our food to see if we need anything. I guess if there's any problem with a restaurant, "Too concerned with needs of customers" is a pretty good problem to have. So no points docked from them for now, but if it were to happen again I'd consider it. So yeah, Red Robin. Good stuff. It's gonna be a thing.

Yelp is all about personal opinion and my personal opinion is that in the land of family-friendly chain restaurants Red Robin is king, reigning over mere proletariat pretenders to the throne. Somehow, they always seem to get it right, from the very first impression as you walk in - bright, colorful decor, friendly faces to greet you - and right through the whole concept of proper customer service and the dining experience. We have visited a dozen or more Red Robins across the country and it's difficult for me to fault any of them... and regular readers of my reviews will know I find fault easily! The attitude must stem from the top down and it shows in the response of the servers. Always friendly, generally willing to joke and laugh and work with whatever quirks you might have. For instance - and I don't know if this is the result of my European upbringing - I refuse to eat out of a basket when eating at a proper restaurant. To me, eating from a basket reminds me of standing in a motorway lay-by in the early hours of the morning chucking a greasy kebab down my throat to soak up the effects of too much alcohol from the night before. Now, some may be happy to eat a $10 'gourmet burger' (Red Robin's specialty) from a plastic basket, but I always ... ALWAYS ... request to have my food placed on a proper plate. And a server has never raised their eyebrows at me, or questioned my decision. Now, granted, they may have gone back to the kitchen and shouted "the English twat at table 37 wants his burger on a plate" but I personally have never felt embarrassed about my quirk. So kudos to the staff for that! Then there's the food itself. They have managed to concoct some spectacularly-tasty burgers in the time we have been going to Red Robin, but for me their Whiskey River BBQ Burger certainly takes some beating. A couple of years ago - when I was on a temporary bread-free diet and tried this option - I asked for it to come in a lettuce wrap and for whatever reason it has made the taste even more powerful and scrumptious and now I always ask for it that way. The lettuce seems to add a marvelous level of 'crunch' to the proceedings, setting off the crispy onion straws and various fixings just perfectly. (As always, and dependent on your taste buds, your mileage may of course vary) And then there's the fries. Bottomless steak fries, never stale, fresh and always cooked to perfection. I eat too many of them every time. They may be bottomless but I am certainly not, the size of my rear end growing larger with every visit. I am somewhat thankful there is not a Red Robin within easy walking/driving distance of my home, otherwise I would be a regular customer at the Big & Large shop and ordering my pants in a size with way too many X's. All because of the yummy fries. It's not the only menu item that is bottomless... they do something called a freckled lemonade - a blend of real strawberries & tangy lemonade - which will be served to you until your bladder is ready to unceremoniously go bang. The phrase "sugar rush" doesn't even match the initial sip and it won't take long before you're bouncing off the walls. There's lots of cocktails too. And beers. And desserts. And onion ring towers. And they do a mean cod & chips which surprises me with its fresh taste given we're usually some 1000+ miles from any coastline. It's a perfect place for families and seems very kid-friendly indeed, younger diners offered their own special menu at keen prices. My advice would be to sign up for their Red Robin Reward Card which you show to the server and which not only gains you a free burger for every nine that you buy but gives you a free burger during the month of your birthday. Plus, as I found out earlier in the year, you might also find yourself with a free birthday sundae to share with your guests at the end of your main meals. Be warned however, that you may also be sung at by all the staff, so there IS a price to pay for that sundae! Yummmmm! indeed!!

I love this place!!!!!! Bottomless fries, Veggie burger, what more can you like?? When they say Red Robin Yum they mean it because it really is beyond yum it is heavenly! The food is great, the staff is always friendly when I go there and I always come out happy. Thank you Red Robin!
Red Robin? More like "They're Robbin'.......You of a Good Burger"!!!

Went to this Red Robin location last night with a friend. Food was good and loved the Very Berry Raspberry Limeade- not too sweet, tart and refreshing on a super hot evening. DJ our waiter couldn't do enough for us. Attentive without being over bearing. I rated this as A-OK, just because I'm not a huge burger fan. It was good but not like awesome so I've not rated it super high. Was very pleased to see I could get it w/o the bun- since I'm trying to make healthier food choices. Pleas don't tell me how much sugar is the the limeade- it will ruin all the pride in not having a bun. DJ (our waiter) told us their shakes are to die for, can't attest to that but the person next to us seemed to be enjoying one.

First time visiting this location.  We were both starving, but we didn't want burgers...so we ordered their salad.  They were AWESOME!  My husband got the Avo-Cobb-O Salad, which I was eyeing, so I got the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad.  The Avo-Cobb-O was HUGE! My husband couldn't finish it & took almost 1/2 of it home.  The Southwest grilled Chicken Salad was a lot smaller, actually, perfect size for a lunch salad.  We were very surprised/impressed.  For a chain restaurant, this place is pretty good.
The customer service was excellent. I love their unlimited supply of sweet potato fries. The burger was delicious and juicy.

Annoying commercials led me to avoid this place for so long. I was wrong. Red Robin is a good time. The food is consistent and good. Not fine dining, not even really creative, but it's good every time and when it's not they take care of it.  My recommendations are the Grilled Chicken Alla Caprese Salad, the sweet potato fries and the veggie burger. That Boy is a fan of the regular cheeseburger and the chicken tenders (not shocking to anyone who knows him). We also love the endless steak fries.  The service is usually attentive and fast. Especially for a chain. The tables and restroom are always clean and usually the wait isn't that bad for a table. The one time my order came out wrong my server quickly replaced it with the right dish and it was taken off our bill completely without even having to ask. That kind of service is what encourages us to return here. I also suggest getting the Red Royalty card. After 9 entrees you get one free, you also get a free burger and fries during your birthday month and other surprises throughout the year. The volume in the place can get kind of crazy as it is a family place and there are always kids there screaming and running amuck. So be prepared for that.  So, if you're stuck for a place to go in the Florence area, check it out.

We have been there twice and I was not impressed. The food is okay, but expensive. The service somewhat slow. You can get a better burger other places for much cheaper. It is also inconvenient to get in and out of the parking lot

Food is good beer and alcohol is expensive and the service isn't all that great... I have been here maybe 3 or more times and only had decent service once, but I have been to other locations and had outstanding service. Also their ranch dressing is awesome!

Had never been to one before and we chose the right day to go. Kristen our server (slash bartender) was the best and made great suggestions on what to try. I got the pub burger and ENDLESS steak fries. Found out I'm not the only one who likes to mix ranch dressing and ketchup to dip my fries. The seasoned salt is the best there as well. Our order arrived quickly, refills were there without asking, and the food was excellent. For a chain restaurant I'd have to say it's one of the best I've been to!

Yum. I always get the royal red robin burger. I love eggs so a fried egg on top of a burger and unlimited fries. YAY! You can get the fries garlic style if you ask them too. It's not on the menu, but my friend always orders it.

Wow!  This place is really awesome!  We went when it had only been open like for a month or so ... so it was really busy with lines and all that.  Bottomless fries are amazing and their other food is good too.  My family went there and besides my son being a brat there it was a very good experience.  Food took a lil to get, but once it got there it was REALLY good.  I ordered the Burnin' love burger and boy did I find out why its called that... later on...   :D  but yeah definately go here if you wanna pay a little extra for an AWESOME HAMBURGER and FRIES!

This was an awesome experience. I had RR for the first time in July. The restaurant just opened in Florence not all that long before. The service was decent, the food really good and hot, and oh yeah, the Bottomless Steak Fries are really bottomless! I had two or three helpings and still could have had more! All of this for around ten bucks! My family has raved about it, and after eating there myself, I could understand why.

The new Mt. Olympus burger is SO GOOD. Oregano-seasoned, spinach artichoke dip, feta cheese, lettuce, tomato, on ciabatta bread. And as always, bottomless fries and drink, in addition to great service. The only thing making me give RR 4.5 stars vs a 5 is the dreaded birthday singing, always at a nearby table. I know it's a necessary evil in chain places like this, but ugh. The free birthday burger you get from the being in the email club should be enough!
fun casual atmosphere,  burgers are great and huge..... strawberry lemonade is great....and bottomless

If you crave a gormet hamburger, Red Robin is the place for you!  They have "bottomless" soft drinks and endless steak fries.  Sometimes they don't seem to want to push them, as most probably won't need more than one order. The burgers come in all varieties and are huge!  It also has a full bar and is kid friendly.  A nice family sit down restaurant.
Love the hamburgers and the chicken sandwich was Amazing but every time I leave this place I feel like a major slob but it's so good
